title.native: 鋼の錬金術師 FULLMETAL ALCHEMIST

description:
"In order for something to be obtained, something of equal value must be lost."

Alchemy is bound by this Law of Equivalent Exchange—something the young brothers Edward and Alphonse Elric only realize after attempting human transmutation: the one forbidden act of alchemy. They pay a terrible price for their transgression—Edward loses his left leg, Alphonse his physical body. It is only by the desperate sacrifice of Edward's right arm that he is able to affix Alphonse's soul to a suit of armor. Devastated and alone, it is the hope that they would both eventually return to their original bodies that gives Edward the inspiration to obtain metal limbs called "automail" and become a state alchemist, the Fullmetal Alchemist.

Three years of searching later, the brothers seek the Philosopher's Stone, a mythical relic that allows an alchemist to overcome the Law of Equivalent Exchange. Even with military allies Colonel Roy Mustang, Lieutenant Riza Hawkeye, and Lieutenant Colonel Maes Hughes on their side, the brothers find themselves caught up in a nationwide conspiracy that leads them not only to the true nature of the elusive Philosopher's Stone, but their country's murky history as well. In between finding a serial killer and racing against time, Edward and Alphonse must ask themselves if what they are doing will make them human again... or take away their humanity.

(Source: MAL Rewrite)
synonyms: 钢之炼金术师 FULLMETAL ALCHEMIST
แขนกล คนแปรธาตุ: บราเธอร์ฮูด

tags.name: Alchemy
tags.description: Features character(s) who practice alchemy.

tags.name: Conspiracy
tags.description: Contains one or more factions controlling or attempting to control the world from the shadows.

tags.name: Military
tags.description: Centered around the life and activities of military personnel.

tags.name: Tragedy
tags.description: Centers around tragic events and unhappy endings.

tags.name: War
tags.description: Partly or completely set during wartime.

tags.name: Shounen
tags.description: Target demographic is teenage and young adult males.

tags.name: Politics
tags.description: Centers around politics, politicians, or government activities.

tags.name: Male Protagonist
tags.description: Main character is male.

tags.name: Philosophy
tags.description: Relating or devoted to the study of the fundamental nature of knowledge, reality, and existence.

tags.name: Ensemble Cast
tags.description: Features a large cast of characters with (almost) equal screen time and importance to the plot.

tags.name: Coming of Age
tags.description: Centers around a character's transition from childhood to adulthood.

tags.name: Fugitive
tags.description: Prominently features a character evading capture by an individual or organization.

tags.name: Super Power
tags.description: Prominently features characters with special abilities that allow them to do what would normally be physically or logically impossible.

tags.name: Foreign
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a country outside the country of origin.

tags.name: Gods
tags.description: Prominently features a character of divine or religious nature.

tags.name: Cyborg
tags.description: Prominently features a human character whose physiological functions are aided or enhanced by artificial means.

tags.name: Steampunk
tags.description: Prominently features technology and designs inspired by 19th-century industrial steam-powered machinery.

tags.name: Necromancy
tags.description: When the dead are summoned as spirits, skeletons, or the undead, usually for the purpose of gaining information or to be used as a weapon.

tags.name: Disability
tags.description: A work that features one or more characters with a physical, mental, cognitive, or developmental condition that impairs, interferes with, or limits the person's ability to engage in certain tasks or actions.

tags.name: Lost Civilization
tags.description: Featuring a civilization with few ruins or records that exist in present day knowledge.

tags.name: Revenge
tags.description: Prominently features a character who aims to exact punishment in a resentful or vindictive manner.

tags.name: Anachronism
tags.description: Prominently features elements that are out of place in the historical period the work takes place in, particularly modern elements in a historical setting.

tags.name: Chimera
tags.description: Features a beast made by combining animals, usually with humans.

tags.name: Religion
tags.description: Centers on the belief that humanity is related to supernatural, transcendental, and spiritual elements.

tags.name: Travel
tags.description: Centers around character(s) moving between places a significant distance apart.

tags.name: Primarily Male Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of male characters.

tags.name: Dissociative Identities
tags.description: A case where one or more people share the same body.

tags.name: Gore
tags.description: Prominently features graphic bloodshed and violence.

tags.name: Body Horror
tags.description: Features characters who undergo horrific transformations or disfigurement, often to their own detriment.

tags.name: Slapstick
tags.description: Prominently features comedy based on deliberately clumsy actions or embarrassing events.

tags.name: Kuudere
tags.description: Prominently features a character who generally retains a cold, blunt and cynical exterior, but once one gets to know them, they have a very warm and loving interior.

tags.name: Demons
tags.description: Prominently features malevolent otherworldly creatures.

tags.name: Guns
tags.description: Prominently features the use of guns in combat.

tags.name: Chibi
tags.description: Features "super deformed" character designs with smaller, rounder proportions and a cute look.

tags.name: Tomboy
tags.description: Features a girl who exhibits characteristics or behaviors considered in many cultures to be typical of boys.

tags.name: Trains
tags.description: Prominently features trains.

tags.name: Yuri
tags.description: Prominently features romance between two females, not inherently sexual. Also known as Girls' Love.

tags.name: Swordplay
tags.description: Prominently features the use of swords in combat.

tags.name: Adoption
tags.description: Features a character who has been adopted by someone who is neither of their biological parents.

tags.name: Cannibalism
tags.description: Prominently features the act of consuming another member of the same species as food.

tags.name: Shapeshifting
tags.description: Features character(s) who changes one's appearance or form.

tags.name: Desert
tags.description: Prominently features a desert environment.

tags.name: Tanned Skin
tags.description: Prominently features characters with tanned skin.

tags.name: Heterosexual
tags.description: Prominently features a romance between a man and a woman, not inherently sexual.

tags.name: Vore
tags.description: Features a character being swallowed or swallowing another creature whole.

tags.name: Tsundere
tags.description: Prominently features a character who acts cold and hostile in order to mask warmer emotions.

tags.name: Snowscape
tags.description: Prominently or partially set in a snowy environment.

tags.name: Crossdressing
tags.description: Prominently features a character dressing up as the opposite sex.

node.description: __Mike McFarland__ is an American voice actor, ADR Director, Script, and Line Producer at Funimation Entertainment.

__Cousin:__ [Aaron Dismuke](https://anilist.co/staff/95254/Aaron-Dismuke)

__Justin Ryan Cook__ is an American voice actor, producer, line producer, ADR director and enginner who works for FUNimation.

__[Twitter](https://twitter.com/johnburgmeier)__

He is the son of [Linda Young](https://anilist.co/staff/95252).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/caitlinsvoice) | [Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/caitlinsvoice/) | [Myspace](https://myspace.com/caitlintiffany) | [Blog](https://kiristokyoto.livejournal.com/)

An American voice actor, voice director, and script writer for Funimation, New Generation Pictures, and Bang Zoom! Entertainment. She's been working in the anime industry since 2004. She grew up in the San Diego area, California, and has been married to Tony Patterson since 2009. Outside of voice acting, Caitlin has worked as an ESL teacher in Spain.

Her self-portrait is usually that of a bespectacled cow, as she was born and raised in a dairy farm with three older sisters and a younger brother. Arakawa started out as [Etou Hiroyuki's](https://anilist.co/staff/98901/) assistant writer for [Mahoujin Guru Guru](https://anilist.co/manga/34080/) and a friend of [Shakugan no Shana](https://anilist.co/manga/33074/) author [Yashichiro Takahashi](https://anilist.co/staff/99114/). Arakawa's career started with a work titled [STRAY DOG](https://anilist.co/manga/33303/), but she is best known for creating the [Fullmetal Alchemist](https://anilist.co/manga/30025/) world and manga. The author is friends with [Akira Segami](https://anilist.co/staff/97387/).

Due to a lack of real publicity photos of Arakawa, a great sum of her fanbase has no idea what she really looks like, even to this day. There are some scarce pictures of the real Arakawa in the web, but they are very low in quality and are rarely used as reference. Many fans have mistaken photos of [Romi Park](https://anilist.co/staff/95082/Romi-Park), Edward Elric's seiyuu, as photos of Arakawa, because of the set-up in one particular image in which Romi Park poses as a mangaka. Romi Park is known for representing Arakawa in public appearances, in which Arakawa is not able to attend. 

_Awards:_
• 1999: 9th 21st Century Enix Award for "Stray Dog"
• 2003: 49th Shogakukan Manga Award, Shōnen category for "Fullmetal Alchemist"
• 2011: 15th Tezuka Osamu Cultural Prize, "New Artist Prize" category.
• 2011: 42nd Seiun Award, "Best Science Fiction Comic" category for "Fullmetal Alchemist"
• 2012: 5th Manga Taishō Award for "Silver Spoon"
• 2012: 58th Shogakukan Manga Award, Shōnen category for "Silver Spoon"
• 2013: 1st Contents Award of Japan Food Culture Grand Prize for "Silver Spoon"
• 2023: 1st Rakuten Kobo's E-Book Manga Award, "I Want to Read it Now! Featured Manga" category for "Yomi no Tsugai"
• 2023: 7th Tsutaya Comic Award for "Yomi no Tsugai"

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/98020267)

Yamada graduated from the Department of Literature at Keio University. While attending the university he was in the same year as the Macross character designer [Haruhiko Mikimoto](https://anilist.co/staff/96968/) and creator [Shouji Kawamori](https://anilist.co/staff/97501/), both of which where the first people he collaborated with in [The Super Dimension Fortress Macross](https://anilist.co/anime/1088//). This marked the start of his scriptwriting career.

__Birth Name:__ Nakagawa (中川) Shiyōko (しようこ)
__Birth Place:__ Nakano, Tokyo, Japan 
__Nickname:__ Shokotan (しょこたん), Shokotasu (ショコタス)  
__Height:__ 156cm  
__BWH:__ 84 - 58 - 84 cm

[Official Website](http://www.nakagawashoko.com/) | [Other Website]( http://shokoland.excite.co.jp/) | [Blog](http://ameblo.jp/nakagawa-shoko/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/shoko55mmts/) | [Sony Music Profile](http://www.sonymusic.co.jp/Music/Arch/SR/ShokoNakagawa/) | [Watanabe Entertainment Profile](http://www.watanabepro.co.jp/mypage/artist/nakagawashoko.html)

She is a Japanese idol, tarento, actress, seiyū (voice actor), illustrator and singer. She is the daughter of [Katsuhiko Nakagawa](https://anilist.co/staff/265314), a celebrity in Japan in the 1980s.

Yui was born in Fukuoka, Japan. She grew up in a single parent family and does not have any memory of her father. She states that she has always been close to music; be it from her mother's car stereo or the radio, she would remember the tunes and sing along.  Her professional career began in March 2004 when, at the recommendation of her juku instructors, she applied for an audition hosted by Sony Music Japan. Despite the audition rule that a participant could only perform two songs, Yui was allowed to sing three. She first sang "Why Me" (a song later included in her debut single), followed by "It's Happy Line" and "I Know". The judges gave her the maximum score, causing a fierce scramble among record labels to sign her. Because "I Know" was incomplete at the time, the judges were able to get a glimpse of what would later be dubbed "Yui-go", or Yui-speak (Yui語 in Japanese), nonsensical English hummed to a tune during her songwriting process — an example of Yui-go can be found in the film Midnight Sun when Yui is working on the song "Goodbye Days".  On December 24, 2004, she released her debut single "It's Happy Line" under indie label Leaflet Records, coupled with the track "I Know". The pressing was limited to only 2,000 copies in her home area. In 2012 she retired from being a soloist. In 2013 she formed the band [FLOWER FLOWER](https://anilist.co/staff/273663/FLOWER-FLOWER).

The founder and former representative director of [Funimation](https://anilist.co/studio/102/).

**Non-anime roles:**
- Policeman in "Chuck E. Cheese in the Galaxy 5000"
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/bang20140617)

Akira Amemiya is an animator and up-and-coming director best known for directing [SSSS.GRIDMAN](https://anilist.co/anime/99424/SSSSGRIDMAN) and being Studio Trigger founder [Hiroyuki Imaishi](https://anilist.co/staff/97349/Hiroyuki-Imaishi)'s protege. Amemiya's [animation and directing](https://blog.sakugabooru.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/02/mini-imaishi.mp4) is very similar to Imaishi's yet is less chaotic and contains more 'retro' devices like impact frames and multi-tonal shading, drawing a lot of inspiration from [Masami Obari](https://anilist.co/staff/100660/Masami-Obari). For these reasons he was frequently typecasted for old school pose-heavy mecha combat.

Amemiya is a nerdy director whose anime often heavily references other series and artists he loves, sometimes even replicating Obari's [animation sequences](https://blog.sakugabooru.com/wp-content/uploads/2018/10/dangaioh2.mp4) and [layouts](https://i.imgur.com/nTRdM4K.jpg), [Transformer](https://twitter.com/SSS_SGRID/status/1051063114022572033)'s color designs, and Hideaki Anno's [establishing shots](https://blog.sakugabooru.com/wp-content/uploads/2018/10/welcome-to-the-anno-class.jpg) as well as long-lingering framing. Amemiya called Anno's [Neon Genesis Evangelion](https://anilist.co/anime/30/Evangelion/) his [favorite series before](https://i.imgur.com/nEYK186.png). Between his ode-heavy artistry he interjects personality with [subtle details](https://blog.sakugabooru.com/wp-content/uploads/2018/10/what-kind-of-brand-is-TOMATO-LIFE-tho.jpg), visual gags, and repurposing tonally contrasting homages into a different context.

Amemiya graduated from Tokyo University of Technology and was part of the university's anime research society. During his time there he became heavily influenced by Osaka University's anime research club [Group CAS](https://twitter.com/group_cas). At the time [Toshiyuki Satou](https://anilist.co/staff/107357/Toshiyuki-Satou) was part of the group, while [Ikehata Hiroshi](https://anilist.co/staff/120505/Ikehata-Hiroshi) visited regularly. After a bit of indie work Amemiya joined studio Gainax and climbed up the hierarchy: from clean-up to animation direction, onto storyboarding and episode directing, until after joining studio Trigger and co-directing Kill la Kill finally having the credentials to debut with his own series.

He is married to animator [Megumi Kouno](https://anilist.co/staff/120602/Megumi-Kouno).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/imozuka) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E7%9F%B3%E9%87%8E%E8%81%A1)

Satoshi Ishino is a Japanese animator, animation supervisor, character/mechanical designer and animation director.

He started working at Studio Giants, but later went to work at Studio Fantasia before becoming a freelance animator. Today he is a part of the animator group Studio Hercules (スタジオへらくれす), and he's also a part of the doujin circle TEAM Imozuka (TEAM いもずか).

Satoshi is best known for his work as a character designer and animation supervisor in the show Excel Saga and the related Puni Puni Poemi.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/132219566) | [Youtube](https://www.youtube.com/user/IRICOMIX)

Affiliated with [Studio 3Hz](https://anilist.co/studio/6069/). One of the key members of JAniCA.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/132219566) | [Youtube](https://www.youtube.com/user/IRICOMIX)

Affiliated with [Studio 3Hz](https://anilist.co/studio/6069/). One of the key members of JAniCA.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/132219566) | [Youtube](https://www.youtube.com/user/IRICOMIX)

Affiliated with [Studio 3Hz](https://anilist.co/studio/6069/). One of the key members of JAniCA.

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/南雅彦) | [Wiki (en)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Masahiko_Minami)

A founder and representative director of studio [Bones](https://anilist.co/studio/4/). Also the leading producer of its Studio B.

After graduating from Osaka University of Arts, Minami joined [Sunrise](https://anilist.co/studio/14/) in 1984. There he did desk work and served as a production assistant on many of [Masuo Ueda](https://anilist.co/staff/148840/)'s productions. He was promoted to producer on [Musha Knight Commando](https://anilist.co/anime/9087/) in 1991, and from there he went on to produce shows such as [Mobile Fighter G Gundam](https://anilist.co/anime/96/), [Vision of Escaflowne](https://anilist.co/anime/182/) and [Cowboy Bebop](https://anilist.co/anime/1/). In 1998, he left Sunrise and established Bones with [Toshihiro Kawamoto](https://anilist.co/staff/103531/) and the late [Hiroshi Ousaka](https://anilist.co/staff/107410/). He was elected as the representative director of the studio and has held the position since.

Minami's classmates at university included [Hideaki Anno](https://anilist.co/staff/100111/), [Hiroyuki Yamaga](https://anilist.co/staff/100988/), and [Kazuhiko Shimamoto](https://anilist.co/staff/97479/). He appears as a character in the manga [Aoi Honoo](https://anilist.co/manga/55292/), which Shimamoto wrote about his own university days. The manga also received a TV drama adaptation, in which Minami was portrayed by actor Kaname Endou.

(Source: Wikipedia)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/sekise10) | [Sakugabooru](https://www.sakugabooru.com/post?tags=yutaka_nakamura) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/中村豊_(アニメーター%29)

Yutaka Nakamura graduated from Yoyogi Animation Gakuin and first joined studio Ad Cosmo. After switching several studios; from Art Office Sharaku, to Anime Torotoro, to [Sunrise](https://anilist.co/studio/14/), he eventually settled at [Bones](https://anilist.co/studio/4/) with a contract.

Nakamura is considered to be among the best action animators, with his scenes featuring catchy movement and effects. Some of his recognizable traits include camera shaking, blurs, and bending and stretching high-speed objects. His fights are praised for its weighty, intense choreographies that are heavy on impact frames. His signature trait is drawing debris as simple cubes, consequentially named "Yutapon Cubes," which are stylistic and easy to draw. Despite being responsible for popularizing it, Nakamura has stated that he started doing it when he noticed [Satoru Utsunomiya](https://anilist.co/staff/101489/) doing it. 

(Source: Animators Wiki)
Freelance. Close friends with [Takahiro Kishida](https://anilist.co/staff/101403/).

Akira Senjuu debuted in the music industry in 1992, by composing the soundtrack for "Mama wa Shougaku Yonensei" anime. He then expanded his work into J-Dramas and movies. In 2001 his music arrangement for J-Drama "Strawberry on the Shortcake"  won in "Best Music Arrangement" nomination of 28th Television Drama Academy Awards.    In anime Industry he is best known for composing the score for Mobile Suit Victory Gundam.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/235154812) | [Pixiv](https://www.pixiv.net/en/users/30949)

Started out as amateur gif animator before turning professional. He initially failed an examination test for [Gainax](https://anilist.co/studio/6/) but was later scouted by the late [Osamu Kobayashi](https://anilist.co/staff/100406/) for [Beck](https://anilist.co/anime/57/). There he met noted animators [Norio Matsumoto](https://anilist.co/staff/100991/) and [Satoru Utsunomiya](https://anilist.co/staff/101489/), the former which he would work with on numerous occasions afterwards.

His breakthrough as an animator was on [Noein](https://anilist.co/anime/584/), a series directed by [Kazuki Akane](https://anilist.co/staff/102416/). The 12th episode was highly regarded by animation fans and other animators for the given display by him and Matsumoto. He would later also serve as a character designer on [Birdy the Mighty: Decode](https://anilist.co/anime/3974/), another series directed by Akane.

His dedication for animation could also be seen on [The Girl Who Leapt Through Time](https://anilist.co/anime/2236/), for which he animated a minute-long scene of the main character running down a street. He went on the actual street in Tokyo to film himself for reference footage for the cut.

SID (シド, Shido) is a Japanese visual kei rock band, formed in 2003 and signed to Ki/oon Records. Formed by Mao, Shinji, Aki and Yūya, they are known for producing anime songs, such as for Fullmetal Alchemist, Bleach, Black Butler or Magi.

__Members:__
- Vocals: Mao (マオ) 
- Guitar: Shinji 
- Bass: Aki (明希) 
- Drums: Yuuya (ゆうや)
